title: Branded Themes
text: brand.yml package includes helper functions theming plotting table packages using brand colors. theme_brand_* functions can used two ways: brand.yml file: functions automatically detect use _brand.yml file current project. can also explicitly pass path brand.yml file brand object. explicit colors: can directly provide colors override default brand colors, use brand = FALSE ignore project _brand.yml files.

title: Branded Themes
text: vignette demonstrates using theme_brand_* functions simple brand object created as_brand_yml(), can imagine YAML stored _brand.yml file project directory. First, ’ll create brand object using subset colors brand.yml project’s _brand.yml file: _brand.yml file project directory, can read read_brand_yml(), just let theme_brand_* functions find automatically.
code: brand <- as_brand_yml(   ' color:   palette:     black: "#1A1A1A"     white: "#F9F9F9"     orange: "#FF6F20"     purple: "#A500B5"     pink: "#FF3D7F"     blue: "#007BFF"     green: "#28A745"   foreground: black   background: white   primary: orange   danger: pink ' )

title: Branded Themes
text: theme_brand_ggplot2() function creates ggplot2 theme using brand colors. can also override individual colors passing directly:
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +   geom_point(size = 2, aes(color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_smooth(method = "lm", formula = y ~ x) +   scale_colour_manual(     values = c(       brand_color_pluck(brand, "blue"),       brand_color_pluck(brand, "purple"),       brand_color_pluck(brand, "green")     )   ) +   labs(     title = "Motor Trend Car Road Tests",     subtitle = "1974 Motor Trend US magazine",     caption = "Data from the 1974 Motor Trend US magazine",     x = "Miles per Gallon",     y = "Weight (1,000 lbs)",     colour = "Cylinders"   ) +   theme_brand_ggplot2(brand)

title: Branded Themes
text: theme_brand_thematic() function sets global theming base R graphics ggplot2. Use thematic_with_theme() apply theme temporarily:
code: library(ggplot2) library(patchwork) library(thematic)  # Use thematic_with_theme to apply the theme temporarily thematic_with_theme(theme_brand_thematic(brand, foreground = "purple"), {   # Generate three scatterplots   plot1 <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +     geom_point()    plot2 <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, disp)) +     geom_point()    plot3 <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, hp)) +     geom_point()    # Display all three scatterplots in same graphic   plot1 + plot2 + plot3 })

title: Branded Themes
text: theme_brand_ggplot2() function works ggiraph interactive plots. can override specific colors using brand defaults:
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggiraph)  cars <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +   geom_point_interactive(aes(     colour = factor(cyl),     tooltip = rownames(mtcars)   )) +   scale_colour_manual(     values = c(       brand_color_pluck(brand, "orange"),       brand_color_pluck(brand, "purple"),       brand_color_pluck(brand, "green")     )   ) +   theme_brand_ggplot2(brand)  girafe(ggobj = cars)

title: Branded Themes
text: theme_brand_plotly() function applies brand colors plotly plots. function also accepts accent parameter highlighting colors:
code: library(plotly) ##  ## Attaching package: 'plotly' ## The following object is masked from 'package:ggplot2': ##  ##     last_plot ## The following object is masked from 'package:stats': ##  ##     filter ## The following object is masked from 'package:graphics': ##  ##     layout p <- plot_ly(   iris,   x = ~Species,   y = ~Sepal.Width,   type = "violin",   box = list(visible = TRUE),   meanline = list(visible = TRUE),   points = "all" )  theme_brand_plotly(p, brand, accent = "pink")

title: Branded Themes
text: theme_brand_gt() function applies brand colors gt tables. use brand’s palette colors directly name:
code: library(gt)  islands_tbl <- dplyr::tibble(name = names(islands), size = islands) islands_tbl <- dplyr::slice_max(islands_tbl, size, n = 10)  theme_brand_gt(   gt(islands_tbl),   brand,   background = "green",   foreground = "white" )

title: Branded Themes
text: theme_brand_flextable() function applies brand colors flextable table. uses foreground background colors brand. ’ll use default brand created : New York Air Quality Measurements Air quality Time Ozone Solar.R Wind Temp Month Day   14.3 56 5 5  194 8.6 69 5 10 18 313 11.5 62 5 4 8 19 20.1 61 5 9 36 118 8.0 72 5 2 19 99 13.8 59 5 8 23 299 8.6 65 5 7 28  14.9 66 5 6 41 190 7.4 67 5 1 12 149 12.6 74 5 3 Daily air quality measurements New York, May September 1973.
code: library(flextable) ##  ## Attaching package: 'flextable' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:plotly': ##  ##     highlight, style ft <- flextable(airquality[sample.int(10), ]) ft <- add_header_row(ft, colwidths = c(4, 2), values = c("Air quality", "Time")) ft <- theme_vanilla(ft) ft <- add_footer_lines(   ft,   "Daily air quality measurements in New York, May to September 1973." ) ft <- set_caption(ft, caption = "New York Air Quality Measurements")  theme_brand_flextable(ft, brand)

what: Unified Branding with a Simple YAML File
title: Unified Branding with a Simple YAML File
text: Centralize brand guidelines single ‘brand.yml’ file, enabling consistent theming across Quarto, Shiny, R applications, reports, presentations minimal configuration.

title: Unified Branding with a Simple YAML File
text: Install latest release brand.yml CRAN : can install development version brand.yml GitHub : Alternatively, can install posit-dev.r-universe.dev :
code: install.packages("brand.yml") # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("posit-dev/brand-yml/pkg-r") install.packages(   'brand.yml',   repos = c('https://posit-dev.r-universe.dev', 'https://cloud.r-project.org') )

title: Unified Branding with a Simple YAML File
text: Use read_brand_yml() read brand.yml file validated consistent R list. can provide path local file, read_brand_yml() look _brand.yml file project.
code: library(brand.yml)  brand <- read_brand_yml(   system.file("examples", "brand-posit.yml", package = "brand.yml") )  brand$color |> str() #> List of 12 #>  $ palette   :List of 7 #>   ..$ blue    : chr "#447099" #>   ..$ orange  : chr "#EE6331" #>   ..$ gray    : chr "#404041" #>   ..$ white   : chr "#FFFFFF" #>   ..$ teal    : chr "#419599" #>   ..$ green   : chr "#72994E" #>   ..$ burgundy: chr "#9A4665" #>  $ foreground: chr "#151515" #>  $ background: chr "#FFFFFF" #>  $ primary   : chr "#447099" #>  $ secondary : chr "#707073" #>  $ tertiary  : chr "#C2C2C4" #>  $ success   : chr "#72994E" #>  $ info      : chr "#419599" #>  $ warning   : chr "#EE6331" #>  $ danger    : chr "#9A4665" #>  $ light     : chr "#FFFFFF" #>  $ dark      : chr "#404041"

code: as_brand_yml(brand)

title: Create a Brand instance from a list or character vector. — as_brand_yml
text: brand list string YAML representing brand, path brand.yml file.

title: Create a Brand instance from a list or character vector. — as_brand_yml
text: normalized brand_yml list.

title: Create a Brand instance from a list or character vector. — as_brand_yml
code: as_brand_yml(" meta:   name: Example Brand  color:   primary: '#FF5733'   secondary: '#33FF57' ") #> ## _brand.yml #> meta: #>   name: #>     short: Example Brand #>     full: Example Brand #> color: #>   primary: '#FF5733' #>   secondary: '#33FF57' #>   as_brand_yml(list(   meta = list(name = "Example Brand"),   color = list(primary = "#FF5733", secondary = "#33FF57") )) #> ## _brand.yml #> meta: #>   name: #>     short: Example Brand #>     full: Example Brand #> color: #>   primary: '#FF5733' #>   secondary: '#33FF57' #>

what: brand.yml: Unified Branding with a Simple YAML File — brand.yml-package
title: brand.yml: Unified Branding with a Simple YAML File — brand.yml-package
text: Read process 'brand.yml' 'YAML' files. 'brand.yml' simple, portable 'YAML' file codifies company's brand guidelines format can used 'Quarto', 'Shiny' 'R' tooling create branded outputs. Maintain unified, branded theming web applications printed reports dashboards presentations consistent look feel.

title: brand.yml: Unified Branding with a Simple YAML File — brand.yml-package
text: Maintainer: Garrick Aden-Buie garrick@posit.co (ORCID) contributors: Posit Software, PBC (ROR) [copyright holder, funder]

what: Extract a color value from a brand object — brand_color_pluck
title: Extract a color value from a brand object — brand_color_pluck
text: Safely extracts color value brand object based provided key. function handles color references resolves , including references palette colors theme colors. detects prevents cyclic references.

title: Extract a color value from a brand object — brand_color_pluck
code: brand_color_pluck(brand, key)

title: Extract a color value from a brand object — brand_color_pluck
text: brand brand object created read_brand_yml() as_brand_yml(). key character string representing color key extract.

title: Extract a color value from a brand object — brand_color_pluck
text: resolved color value (typically hex color code) key exists, otherwise returns key .

title: Extract a color value from a brand object — brand_color_pluck
text: function checks color key main color theme color palette. can resolve references colors (e.g., "primary" references "palette.blue"). cyclic reference detected (e.g., references B references ), function throw error.

title: Extract a color value from a brand object — brand_color_pluck
code: brand <- as_brand_yml(list(   color = list(     primary = "blue",     secondary = "info",     info = "light-blue",     palette = list(       blue = "#004488",       light_blue = "#c3ddff"     )   ) ))  # Extract the primary color brand_color_pluck(brand, "primary") # "#004488" #> [1] "#004488"  # Extract a color that references another color brand_color_pluck(brand, "info") # "#c3ddff" #> [1] "light-blue"  # Extract a color that references another color # which in turn references the palette brand_color_pluck(brand, "secondary") # "#c3ddff" #> [1] "light-blue"  # Extract a color that isn't defined brand_color_pluck(brand, "green") # "green" #> [1] "green"  # Use brand_pluck() if you need direct (resolved) values brand_pluck(brand, "color", "primary") # "#004488" #> [1] "#004488" brand_pluck(brand, "color", "info") # "#c3ddff" #> [1] "light-blue" brand_pluck(brand, "color", "green") # NULL #> NULL

what: Check if a brand has a specific nested element — brand_has
title: Check if a brand has a specific nested element — brand_has
text: Checks given brand object specific nested element accessible via additional arguments provided key paths.

title: Check if a brand has a specific nested element — brand_has
code: brand_has(brand, ...)

title: Check if a brand has a specific nested element — brand_has
text: brand brand object created read_brand_yml() as_brand_yml(). ... One character strings symbols representing path nested element.

title: Check if a brand has a specific nested element — brand_has
text: TRUE nested element exists brand object, FALSE otherwise.

title: Check if a brand has a specific nested element — brand_has
code: brand <- as_brand_yml(list(   meta = list(name = "Example Brand"),   color = list(primary = "#FF5733") ))  # Check if brand has a primary color brand_has(brand, "color", "primary") # TRUE #> [1] TRUE  # Check if brand has a secondary color brand_has(brand, "color", "secondary") # FALSE #> [1] FALSE

what: Extract a nested element from a brand object — brand_pluck
title: Extract a nested element from a brand object — brand_pluck
text: Safely extracts nested element brand object using provided key path. Returns NULL element exist.

title: Extract a nested element from a brand object — brand_pluck
code: brand_pluck(brand, ...)

title: Extract a nested element from a brand object — brand_pluck
text: brand brand object created read_brand_yml() as_brand_yml(). ... One character strings symbols representing path nested element.

title: Extract a nested element from a brand object — brand_pluck
text: value nested element exists, NULL otherwise.

title: Extract a nested element from a brand object — brand_pluck
code: brand <- as_brand_yml(list(   meta = list(name = "Example Brand"),   color = list(primary = "#FF5733") ))  # Extract the primary color brand_pluck(brand, "color", "primary") # "#FF5733" #> [1] "#FF5733"  # Try to extract a non-existent element brand_pluck(brand, "color", "secondary") # NULL #> NULL

code: brand_sass_color(brand)

title: Generate Sass variables for brand colors — brand_sass_color
text: brand list string YAML representing brand, path brand.yml file.

title: Generate Sass variables for brand colors — brand_sass_color
text: list one component: defaults: Sass variable definitions !default flag

title: Generate Sass variables for brand colors — brand_sass_color
code: brand <- list(   color = list(     primary = "#007bff",     danger = "#dc3545"   ) )  brand_sass_color(brand) #> $defaults #> $defaults$brand_color_primary #> [1] "#007bff !default" #>  #> $defaults$brand_color_danger #> [1] "#dc3545 !default" #>  #>

what: Generate Sass variables and CSS custom properties for brand color palette — brand_sass_color_palette
title: Generate Sass variables and CSS custom properties for brand color palette — brand_sass_color_palette
text: Converts color palette entries brand object Sass variables brand- prefix CSS custom properties --brand- prefix.

title: Generate Sass variables and CSS custom properties for brand color palette — brand_sass_color_palette
code: brand_sass_color_palette(brand)

title: Generate Sass variables and CSS custom properties for brand color palette — brand_sass_color_palette
text: brand list string YAML representing brand, path brand.yml file.

title: Generate Sass variables and CSS custom properties for brand color palette — brand_sass_color_palette
text: list two components: defaults: Sass variable definitions !default flag rules: CSS rules define custom properties :root

title: Generate Sass variables and CSS custom properties for brand color palette — brand_sass_color_palette
code: brand <- list(   color = list(     palette = list(       primary = "#007bff",       secondary = "#6c757d"     )   ) )  brand_sass_color_palette(brand) #> $defaults #> $defaults$`brand-primary` #> [1] "#007bff !default" #>  #> $defaults$`brand-secondary` #> [1] "#6c757d !default" #>  #>  #> $rules #> [1] ":root { --brand-primary:#007bff;--brand-secondary:#6c757d; }" #>

what: Generate Sass variables and layer for Bootstrap defaults — brand_sass_defaults_bootstrap
title: Generate Sass variables and layer for Bootstrap defaults — brand_sass_defaults_bootstrap
text: Creates Sass variables sass layer Bootstrap defaults defined brand object. Allows overriding defaults sources like Shiny themes.

title: Generate Sass variables and layer for Bootstrap defaults — brand_sass_defaults_bootstrap
code: brand_sass_defaults_bootstrap(brand, overrides = "shiny.theme")

title: Generate Sass variables and layer for Bootstrap defaults — brand_sass_defaults_bootstrap
text: brand list string YAML representing brand, path brand.yml file. overrides Path override defaults, e.g., "shiny.theme"

title: Generate Sass variables and layer for Bootstrap defaults — brand_sass_defaults_bootstrap
text: list two components: defaults: Sass variable definitions !default flag layer: sass_layer object functions, mixins, rules

title: Generate Sass variables and layer for Bootstrap defaults — brand_sass_defaults_bootstrap
code: brand <- list(   defaults = list(     bootstrap = list(       defaults = list(         primary = "#007bff",         enable_rounded = TRUE       ),       functions = "@function brand-function() { @return true; }"     ),     shiny = list(       theme = list(         defaults = list(           primary = "#428bca"  # Override bootstrap primary         )       )     )   ) )  brand_sass_defaults_bootstrap(brand) #> $defaults #> $defaults$enable_rounded #> [1] "true !default" #>  #> $defaults$primary #> [1] "#428bca !default" #>  #>  #> $layer #> /* Sass Bundle */ #> @function brand-function() { @return true; } #> /* *** */ #>

what: Generate Sass variables and CSS rules for brand fonts — brand_sass_fonts
title: Generate Sass variables and CSS rules for brand fonts — brand_sass_fonts
text: Creates Sass variables CSS rules fonts defined brand object. Supports Google fonts, Bunny fonts, file-based fonts.

title: Generate Sass variables and CSS rules for brand fonts — brand_sass_fonts
code: brand_sass_fonts(brand)

title: Generate Sass variables and CSS rules for brand fonts — brand_sass_fonts
text: brand list string YAML representing brand, path brand.yml file.

title: Generate Sass variables and CSS rules for brand fonts — brand_sass_fonts
text: list two components: defaults: Sass variables font definitions rules: CSS rules applying fonts via classes

title: Generate Sass variables and CSS rules for brand fonts — brand_sass_fonts
code: brand <- list(   typography = list(     fonts = list(       list(         family = "Roboto",         source = "google",         weight = c(400, 700),         style = "normal"       )     )   ) )  brand_sass_fonts(brand) #> $defaults #> $defaults$`brand-font-roboto` #> $families #> [1] "Roboto" #>  #> $html_deps #> function ()  #> dep_func(x) #> <bytecode: 0x55c59a1fe118> #> <environment: 0x55c5986adef0> #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "shiny.tag.function" #>  #> $default_flag #> [1] TRUE #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "font_collection" "list"            #>  #>  #> $rules #> $rules[[1]] #> [1] ".brand-font-roboto { font-family: $brand-font-roboto; }" #>  #>

what: Generate Sass variables for brand typography — brand_sass_typography
title: Generate Sass variables for brand typography — brand_sass_typography
text: Creates Sass variables typography settings brand_typography_ prefix. Font size values pixels converted rem units, color references resolved.

title: Generate Sass variables for brand typography — brand_sass_typography
code: brand_sass_typography(brand)

title: Generate Sass variables for brand typography — brand_sass_typography
text: brand list string YAML representing brand, path brand.yml file.

title: Generate Sass variables for brand typography — brand_sass_typography
text: list one component: defaults: Sass variable definitions !default flag

title: Generate Sass variables for brand typography — brand_sass_typography
code: brand <- list(   typography = list(     base = list(       size = "16px",       "line-height" = 1.5     ),     headings = list(       weight = "bold",       style = "normal"     )   ) )  brand_sass_typography(brand) #> $defaults #> $defaults$brand_typography_base_size #> [1] "1rem !default" #>  #> $defaults$brand_typography_base_line_height #> [1] "1.5 !default" #>  #> $defaults$brand_typography_headings_weight #> [1] "bold !default" #>  #> $defaults$brand_typography_headings_style #> [1] "normal !default" #>  #>

what: Extract a logo resource from a brand — brand_use_logo
title: Extract a logo resource from a brand — brand_use_logo
text: Returns brand logo resource specified name variant brand object. image paths returned object adjusted absolute, relative location brand YAML file, brand read file, local working directory otherwise.

title: Extract a logo resource from a brand — brand_use_logo
code: brand_use_logo(   brand,   name,   variant = c("auto", "light", "dark", "light-dark"),   ...,   .required = !name %in% c("small", "medium", "large", "smallest", "largest"),   .allow_fallback = TRUE )

title: Extract a logo resource from a brand — brand_use_logo
text: brand brand object read_brand_yml() as_brand_yml(). name name logo use. Either size ("small", "medium", "large") image name brand.logo.images. Alternatively, can also use "smallest" "largest" select smallest largest available logo size, respectively. variant variant use, used name one brand.yml fixed logo sizes ("small", "medium", "large"). Can one : "auto": Auto-detect, returns light/dark logo resource variants present, otherwise returns single logo resource, either value brand.logo.{name} single light dark variant one present. "light": Returns light variant. light variant present, brand.logo.{name} single logo resource allow_fallback TRUE, brand_use_logo() falls back single logo resource. "dark": Returns dark variant, , , falls back single logo resource dark variant present allow_fallback TRUE. "light-dark": Returns light/dark object variants. single logo resource present brand.logo.{name} allow_fallback TRUE, single logo resource promoted light/dark logo resource identical light dark variants. ... Additional named attributes added image HTML markdown created via format(), knitr::knit_print(), htmltools::.tags(). .required Logical character string. TRUE, error thrown requested logo found. string, used describe logo required error message completes phrase "required ____". Defaults FALSE name one fixed sizes – "small", "medium", "large" "smallest" "largest". Otherwise, error thrown default requested logo found. .allow_fallback TRUE (default), allows falling back non-variant-specific logo specific variant requested. used name one fixed logo sizes ("small", "medium", "large").

title: Extract a logo resource from a brand — brand_use_logo
text: brand_logo_resource object, brand_logo_resource_light_dark object, NULL requested logo exist .required FALSE.

title: Extract a logo resource from a brand — brand_use_logo
text: can use brand_use_logo() include logos Shiny apps HTML documents produced Quarto R Markdown. Shiny apps, logos returned brand_use_logo() automatically converted HTML tags using htmltools::.tags(), can include directly UI code. brand includes light/dark variant specific size, images included app, appropriate image shown based user's system preference app's current theme mode using bslib::input_dark_mode(). include additional classes attributes tag, can call htmltools::.tags() directly provide attributes: applies HTML documents produced Quarto R Markdown, images can used -line: Finally, can use format() convert logo raw HTML markdown:
code: library(shiny) library(bslib) brand <- read_brand_yml() ui <- page_navbar( title = tagList( brand_use_logo(brand, "small"), "Brand Use Logo Test" ), nav_panel( "Page 1", card( card_header("My Brand"), brand_use_logo(brand, "medium", variant = "dark") ) ) # ... The rest of your app ) brand <- as_brand_yml(list( logo = list( images = list( "cat-light" = list( path = "https://placecats.com/louie/300/300", alt = "A light-colored tabby cat on a purple rug" ), "cat-dark" = list( path = "https://placecats.com/millie/300/300", alt = "A dark-colored cat looking into the camera" ), "cat-med" = "https://placecats.com/600/600" ), small = list(light = "cat-light", dark = "cat-dark"), medium = "cat-med" ) )) brand_use_logo(brand, "small") |> htmltools::as.tags(class = "my-logo", height = 32) ```{r} brand_use_logo(brand, "small") ``` This is my brand's medium sized logo: `r brand_use_logo(brand, "medium")` cat(format(brand_use_logo(brand, "small", variant = "light"))) #> cat(format( brand_use_logo(brand, "medium"), .format = "markdown", class = "my-logo", height = 500 )) #> ![](https://placecats.com/600/600){.brand-logo .my-logo alt="" height="500"}

title: Extract a logo resource from a brand — brand_use_logo
code: brand <- as_brand_yml(list(   logo = list(     images = list(       small = "logos/small.png",       huge = list(path = "logos/huge.png", alt = "Huge Logo")     ),     small = "small",     medium = list(       light = list(         path = "logos/medium-light.png",         alt = "Medium Light Logo"       ),       dark = list(path = "logos/medium-dark.png")     )   ) ))  brand_use_logo(brand, "small") #> <brand_logo_resource src="./logos/small.png" alt=""> brand_use_logo(brand, "medium") #> <brand_logo_resource src="./logos/medium-light.png" alt="Medium Light Logo" variant="light"> #> <brand_logo_resource src="./logos/medium-dark.png" alt="" variant="dark"> brand_use_logo(brand, "large") #> NULL brand_use_logo(brand, "huge") #> <brand_logo_resource src="./logos/huge.png" alt="Huge Logo">  brand_use_logo(brand, "small", variant = "light") #> <brand_logo_resource src="./logos/small.png" alt=""> brand_use_logo(brand, "small", variant = "light", allow_fallback = FALSE) #> <brand_logo_resource src="./logos/small.png" alt="" allow_fallback="false"> brand_use_logo(brand, "small", variant = "light-dark") #> <brand_logo_resource src="./logos/small.png" alt="" variant="light"> #> <brand_logo_resource src="./logos/small.png" alt="" variant="dark"> brand_use_logo(   brand,   "small",   variant = "light-dark",   allow_fallback = FALSE ) #> <brand_logo_resource src="./logos/small.png" alt="" variant="light"> #> <brand_logo_resource src="./logos/small.png" alt="" variant="dark">  brand_use_logo(brand, "medium", variant = "light") #> <brand_logo_resource src="./logos/medium-light.png" alt="Medium Light Logo"> brand_use_logo(brand, "medium", variant = "dark") #> <brand_logo_resource src="./logos/medium-dark.png" alt=""> brand_use_logo(brand, "medium", variant = "light-dark") #> <brand_logo_resource src="./logos/medium-light.png" alt="Medium Light Logo" variant="light"> #> <brand_logo_resource src="./logos/medium-dark.png" alt="" variant="dark">

text: path path brand.yml file directory _brand.yml expected found.

title: Create a Brand instance from a Brand YAML file. — read_brand_yml

title: Create a Brand instance from a Brand YAML file. — read_brand_yml
text: default, read_brand_yml() finds project-specific _brand.yml file, looking current working directory directory parent directory _brand.yml, brand/_brand.yml _brand/_brand.yml file (variants .yaml extension). path provided, read_brand_yml() looks files provided directory; automatic discovery, read_brand_yml() starts search working directory moves upward find _brand.yml file.

title: Create a Brand instance from a Brand YAML file. — read_brand_yml
text: https://posit-dev.github.io/brand-yml/

title: Create a Brand instance from a Brand YAML file. — read_brand_yml
code: # For this example: copy a brand.yml to a temporary directory tmp_dir <- tempfile() dir.create(tmp_dir) file.copy(   system.file("examples/brand-posit.yml", package = "brand.yml"),   file.path(tmp_dir, "_brand.yml") ) #> [1] TRUE  brand <- read_brand_yml(tmp_dir)

what: Create a ggplot2 theme using brand colors — theme_brand_ggplot2
title: Create a ggplot2 theme using brand colors — theme_brand_ggplot2
text: Create ggplot2 theme using explicit colors automatically extracting colors brand.yml file.

title: Create a ggplot2 theme using brand colors — theme_brand_ggplot2
code: theme_brand_ggplot2(   brand = NULL,   background = NULL,   foreground = NULL,   accent = NULL,   ...,   base_size = 11,   title_size = base_size * 1.2,   title_color = NULL,   line_color = NULL,   rect_fill = NULL,   text_color = NULL,   plot_background_fill = NULL,   panel_background_fill = NULL,   panel_grid_major_color = NULL,   panel_grid_minor_color = NULL,   axis_text_color = NULL,   plot_caption_color = NULL )

title: Create a ggplot2 theme using brand colors — theme_brand_ggplot2
text: brand One : NULL (default): Automatically detect read _brand.yml file path brand.yml file directory containing _brand.yml brand object (returned read_brand_yml() as_brand_yml()) FALSE: use brand file; explicit colors must provided background background color, defaults brand.color.background. provided directly, value can valid R color name color brand.color brand.color.palette. foreground foreground color, defaults brand.color.foreground. provided directly, value can valid R color name color brand.color brand.color.palette. accent accent color, defaults brand.color.primary brand.color.palette.accent. provided directly, value can valid R color name color brand.color brand.color.palette. ... Reserved future use. base_size Base font size points. Used size property ggplot2::element_text() text theme element. title_size Title font size points. Used size property ggplot2::element_text() title theme element. Defaults base_size * 1.2. title_color, Color color property ggplot2::element_text() title theme element. Can valid R color name color brand.color brand.color.palette. provided, defaults foreground color. line_color Color color property ggplot2::element_line() line theme element. Can valid R color name color brand.color brand.color.palette. provided, defaults blend foreground background colors. rect_fill Fill color fill property ggplot2::element_rect() rect theme element. Can valid R color name color brand.color brand.color.palette. provided, defaults background color. text_color Color color property ggplot2::element_text() text theme element. Can valid R color name color brand.color brand.color.palette. provided, defaults blend foreground background colors. plot_background_fill Fill color fill property ggplot2::element_rect() plot.background theme element. Can valid R color name color brand.color brand.color.palette. provided, defaults background color. panel_background_fill Fill color fill property ggplot2::element_rect() panel.background theme element. Can valid R color name color brand.color brand.color.palette. provided, defaults background color. panel_grid_major_color Color color property ggplot2::element_line() panel.grid.major theme element. Can valid R color name color brand.color brand.color.palette. provided, defaults blend foreground background colors. panel_grid_minor_color Color color property ggplot2::element_line() panel.grid.minor theme element. Can valid R color name color brand.color brand.color.palette. provided, defaults blend foreground background colors. axis_text_color Color color property ggplot2::element_text() axis.text theme element. Can valid R color name color brand.color brand.color.palette. provided, defaults blend foreground background colors. plot_caption_color Color color property ggplot2::element_text() plot.caption theme element. Can valid R color name color brand.color brand.color.palette. provided, defaults blend foreground background colors.

title: Create a ggplot2 theme using brand colors — theme_brand_ggplot2
text: ggplot2::theme() object.

title: Create a ggplot2 theme using brand colors — theme_brand_ggplot2
text: theme_brand_* functions can used two ways: brand.yml file: theme_brand_* functions use read_brand_yml() automatically detect use _brand.yml file current project. can also explicitly pass path brand.yml file brand object (returned read_brand_yml() created as_brand_yml()). brand provided, theme functions use colors defined brand file automatically. explicit colors: can directly provide colors override default brand colors, can use brand = FALSE ignore project _brand.yml files use explicitly provided colors.

title: Create a ggplot2 theme using brand colors — theme_brand_ggplot2
code: brand <- as_brand_yml(' color:   palette:     black: "#1A1A1A"     white: "#F9F9F9"     orange: "#FF6F20"   foreground: black   background: white   primary: orange')  library(ggplot2) ggplot(diamonds, aes(carat, price)) +   geom_point() +   theme_brand_ggplot2(brand)

title: Create a thematic theme using brand colors — theme_brand_thematic
text: theme_brand_thematic(): brand.yml wrapper thematic::thematic_theme() theme_brand_thematic_on(): brand.yml wrapper thematic::thematic_theme()

title: Create a thematic theme using brand colors — theme_brand_thematic
code: brand <- as_brand_yml(' color:   palette:     black: "#1A1A1A"     white: "#F9F9F9"     orange: "#FF6F20"   foreground: black   background: white   primary: orange')   library(ggplot2)  thematic::thematic_with_theme(theme_brand_thematic(brand), {   ggplot(diamonds, aes(carat, price)) +     geom_point() })

title: Temporarily set the BRAND_YML_PATH environment variable — with_brand_yml_path
text: function sets BRAND_YML_PATH environment variable specified path duration local environment. ensures , scope local environment, calls functions automatically discover _brand.yml file use path specified.

title: Temporarily set the BRAND_YML_PATH environment variable — with_brand_yml_path
code: with_brand_yml_path(path, code)  local_brand_yml_path(path, .local_envir = parent.frame())

title: Temporarily set the BRAND_YML_PATH environment variable — with_brand_yml_path
text: with_brand_yml_path(): Run code temporary environment BRAND_YML_PATH environment variable set path. local_brand_yml_path(): Set BRAND_YML_PATH environment variable scope local environment (e.g. within current function).

title: Temporarily set the BRAND_YML_PATH environment variable — with_brand_yml_path
code: # Create a temporary brand.yml file in a tempdir for this example tmpdir <- withr::local_tempdir("brand") path_brand <- file.path(tmpdir, "my-brand.yml") yaml::write_yaml(   list(color = list(primary = "#abc123")),   path_brand ) #> Warning: cannot open file '/tmp/Rtmp1nIO6F/brand1f5777eb694b/my-brand.yml': No such file or directory #> Error in file(file, "w", encoding = fileEncoding): cannot open the connection  with_brand_yml_path(path_brand, {   brand <- read_brand_yml()   brand$color$primary }) #> Error in as_brand_yml(path): `brand` must be a path to a brand.yml file or a string of YAML.

title: brand.yml 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-11-06 Initial CRAN submission.
